main event: A military pilot instructor in New Mexico observed a metallic, disc-shaped object in the air, which appeared to change position and have a flashing surface before disappearing after about 7 minutes.
interesting points: The object was described as disc-shaped and metallic in appearance, resembling a sun and flashing intermittently.
It changed its position freely and exposed different surfaces during the observation.
The sighting lasted 5-7 minutes before the object disappeared.
The conclusion on the record card indicates that it was probably a balloon, yet it was classified as unidentified with no further investigation.
The observation took place in 1955 during the Project Blue Book investigations conducted by the United States Air Force.
